item.title: Two poems – by Zoya Chadha
item.description: **“After all, Punjabi is spoken on both sides of the border, divided only by the script”~ ** This is the splintering. This is the passport which still reads Lahore, India. This is also the indiscretion. What no scrubbing can erase, for the way sameness seeps through cracks and makes itself known. To speak my father’s tongue is to be absent. It is to wash one’s hair with unknown waters and allow
